00034 /* static filesystem info.
00035  * The access is thread-safe because
00036  * it is read-only, except during initialization.
00037  */
00038 fsal_staticfsinfo_t   global_fs_info;
00039 
00040 
00041 /* filesystem info for HPSS */
00042 static fsal_staticfsinfo_t default_hpss_info =
00043   {
00044     0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFLL, /* max file size (64bits) */
00045     NS_MAX_HARD_LINK_VALUE, /* max links */
00046     FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN, /* max filename */
00047     FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, /* min filename */
00048     TRUE,  /* no_trunc */
00049     TRUE,  /* chown restricted */
00050     FALSE, /* case insensitivity */
00051     TRUE,  /* case preserving */
00052     FSAL_EXPTYPE_PERSISTENT, /* FH expire type */
00053     TRUE,  /* hard link support */
00054     TRUE,  /* symlink support */
00055     FALSE, /* lock management */
00056     TRUE,  /* named attributes are supported */
00057     TRUE,  /* handles are unique and persistent */
00058     {10,0}, /* Duration of lease at FS in seconds */
00059     FSAL_ACLSUPPORT_ALLOW,     /* ACL support */
00060     TRUE,  /* can change times */
00061     TRUE,  /* homogenous */
00062     HPSS_SUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTES, /* supported attributes */
00063     (1024*1024),     /* maxread size */
00064     (1024*1024),     /* maxwrite size */
00065     0,     /* default umask */
00066     0,     /* don't allow cross fileset export path */
00067     0400   /* default access rights for xattrs: root=RW, owner=R */
00068   };

00077 /* variables for limiting the calls to the filesystem */
00078 static int limit_calls = FALSE;
00079 semaphore_t sem_fs_calls;

00081 
00082 /* threads keys for stats */
00083 static pthread_key_t key_stats ;
00084 static pthread_once_t once_key = PTHREAD_ONCE_INIT ;
00085 
00086 /* init keys */
00087 static void init_keys( void )
00088 {
00089   if( pthread_key_create( &key_stats, NULL ) == -1 )
00090       DisplayErrorJd( fsal_log, ERR_SYS , ERR_PTHREAD_KEY_CREATE, errno );
00091   
00092   return ;
00093 } /* init_keys */

00107 void fsal_increment_nbcall( int function_index , fsal_status_t  status )
00108 {
00109   
00110   fsal_statistics_t * bythread_stat = NULL ;
00111 
00112   /* verify index */
00113   
00114   if (function_index >= FSAL_NB_FUNC) return;
00115   
00116   /* first, we init the keys if this is the first time */
00117   
00118   if( pthread_once( &once_key, init_keys ) != 0 )
00119   {
00120     DisplayErrorJd( fsal_log, ERR_SYS, ERR_PTHREAD_ONCE, errno );
00121     return;
00122   }
00123   
00124   /* we get the specific value */
00125   
00126   bythread_stat = (fsal_statistics_t *) pthread_getspecific( key_stats ) ;
00127   
00128   /* we allocate stats if this is the first time */
00129   
00130   if( bythread_stat == NULL )
00131   {
00132       int i;
00133       
00134       bythread_stat =
00135             (fsal_statistics_t *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof(fsal_statistics_t )) ;
00136       
00137       if( bythread_stat == NULL )
00138       {
00139         DisplayErrorJd( fsal_log, ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, Mem_Errno );
00140       }
00141       
00142       /* inits the struct */
00143       
00144       for (i=0;i<FSAL_NB_FUNC;i++)
00145       {
00146          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_call[i]=0;
00147          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_success[i]=0;
00148          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_retryable[i]=0;
00149          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[i]=0;
00150       }
00151       
00152       /* set the specific value */
00153       pthread_setspecific( key_stats , (void *)bythread_stat ) ;
00154 
00155   }
00156     
00157   /* we increment the values */
00158   
00159   if ( bythread_stat )
00160   {
00161     bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_call[function_index]++;
00162     
00163     if (  ! FSAL_IS_ERROR(status) )
00164       bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_success[function_index]++;
00165     else if ( fsal_is_retryable(status) )
00166       bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_retryable[function_index]++;
00167     else 
00168       bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[function_index]++;    
00169   }
00170   
00171   return;
00172 }
00173

00186 void fsal_internal_getstats(fsal_statistics_t * output_stats)
00187 {
00188 
00189   fsal_statistics_t * bythread_stat = NULL ;
00190     
00191   /* first, we init the keys if this is the first time */
00192   if( pthread_once( &once_key, init_keys ) != 0 ){
00193     DisplayErrorJd(fsal_log, ERR_SYS, ERR_PTHREAD_ONCE, errno );
00194     return;
00195   }
00196   
00197   /* we get the specific value */
00198   bythread_stat = (fsal_statistics_t *) pthread_getspecific( key_stats ) ;
00199   
00200   /* we allocate stats if this is the first time */
00201   if( bythread_stat == NULL ){
00202       int i;
00203            
00204       if( (
00205             bythread_stat =
00206             (fsal_statistics_t *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof(fsal_statistics_t ))
00207            ) == NULL )
00208         DisplayErrorJd(fsal_log, ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, Mem_Errno );
00209       
00210       /* inits the struct */
00211       for (i=0;i<FSAL_NB_FUNC;i++){
00212          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_call[i]=0;
00213          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_success[i]=0;
00214          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_retryable[i]=0;
00215          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[i]=0;
00216       }
00217       
00218       /* set the specific value */
00219       pthread_setspecific( key_stats , (void *)bythread_stat ) ;
00220 
00221   }
00222   
00223   if (output_stats)
00224     (*output_stats)=(*bythread_stat);
00225   
00226   return;
00227   
00228 }

00268 void  TakeTokenFSCall()
00269 {
00270   /* no limits */
00271   if ( limit_calls == FALSE ) return;
00272   
00273   /* there is a limit */  
00274   semaphore_P( &sem_fs_calls );
00275   
00276 }
00277 
00278 void  ReleaseTokenFSCall()
00279 {
00280   /* no limits */
00281   if ( limit_calls == FALSE ) return;
00282   
00283   /* there is a limit */  
00284   semaphore_V( &sem_fs_calls );
00285   
00286 }

00290 
00291 #define SET_INTEGER_PARAM( cfg, p_init_info, _field )             \
00292     switch( (p_init_info)->behaviors._field ){                    \
00293     case FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE :                                  \
00294       /* force the value in any case */                           \
00295       cfg._field = (p_init_info)->values._field;                  \
00296       break;                                                      \
00297     case FSAL_INIT_MAX_LIMIT :                                    \
00298       /* check the higher limit */                                \
00299       if ( cfg._field > (p_init_info)->values._field )            \
00300         cfg._field = (p_init_info)->values._field ;               \
00301       break;                                                      \
00302     case FSAL_INIT_MIN_LIMIT :                                    \
00303       /* check the lower limit */                                 \
00304       if ( cfg._field < (p_init_info)->values._field )            \
00305         cfg._field = (p_init_info)->values._field ;               \
00306       break;                                                      \
00307     /* In the other cases, we keep the default value. */          \
00308     }
00309     
00310 
00311 #define SET_BITMAP_PARAM( cfg, p_init_info, _field )              \
00312     switch( (p_init_info)->behaviors._field ){                    \
00313     case FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE :                                  \
00314         /* force the value in any case */                         \
00315         cfg._field = (p_init_info)->values._field;                \
00316         break;                                                    \
00317     case FSAL_INIT_MAX_LIMIT :                                    \
00318       /* proceed a bit AND */                                     \
00319       cfg._field &= (p_init_info)->values._field ;                \
00320       break;                                                      \
00321     case FSAL_INIT_MIN_LIMIT :                                    \
00322       /* proceed a bit OR */                                      \
00323       cfg._field |= (p_init_info)->values._field ;                \
00324       break;                                                      \
00325     /* In the other cases, we keep the default value. */          \
00326     }
00327 
00328 
00329 #define SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( cfg, p_init_info, _field )             \
00330     switch( (p_init_info)->behaviors._field ){                    \
00331     case FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE :                                  \
00332         /* force the value in any case */                         \
00333         cfg._field = (p_init_info)->values._field;                \
00334         break;                                                    \
00335     case FSAL_INIT_MAX_LIMIT :                                    \
00336       /* proceed a boolean AND */                                 \
00337       cfg._field = cfg._field && (p_init_info)->values._field ;   \
00338       break;                                                      \
00339     case FSAL_INIT_MIN_LIMIT :                                    \
00340       /* proceed a boolean OR */                                  \
00341       cfg._field = cfg._field && (p_init_info)->values._field ;   \
00342       break;                                                      \
00343     /* In the other cases, we keep the default value. */          \
00344     }
00345

00347 /*
00348  *  This function initializes shared variables of the fsal.
00349  */
00350 fsal_status_t fsal_internal_init_global( fsal_init_info_t      *  fsal_info,
00351                                          fs_common_initinfo_t  *  fs_common_info )
00352 {
00353   
00354   
00355   /* sanity check */
00356   if (!fsal_info || !fs_common_info) ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_FAULT,0);
00357   
00358   /* Setting log info */
00359   fsal_log = fsal_info->log_outputs;
00360   
00361   
00362   /* inits FS call semaphore */
00363   if ( fsal_info->max_fs_calls > 0 )
00364   {
00365     int rc;
00366     
00367     limit_calls = TRUE;
00368     
00369     rc=semaphore_init(&sem_fs_calls, fsal_info->max_fs_calls);
00370     
00371     if (rc != 0) ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_SERVERFAULT,rc);
00372     
00373     DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,
00374         "FSAL INIT: Max simultaneous calls to filesystem is limited to %u.", 
00375         fsal_info->max_fs_calls );
00376     
00377   }
00378   else
00379   {
00380     DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,
00381         "FSAL INIT: Max simultaneous calls to filesystem is unlimited." );
00382   }
00383   
00384   
00385   /* setting default values. */
00386   global_fs_info = default_hpss_info;
00387 
00388   
00389   /* Analyzing fs_common_info struct */  
00390   
00391   if (
00392       (fs_common_info->behaviors.maxfilesize != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00393       (fs_common_info->behaviors.maxlink  != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00394       (fs_common_info->behaviors.maxnamelen != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00395       (fs_common_info->behaviors.maxpathlen != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00396       (fs_common_info->behaviors.no_trunc != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00397       (fs_common_info->behaviors.case_insensitive != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00398       (fs_common_info->behaviors.case_preserving != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00399       (fs_common_info->behaviors.named_attr != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00400       (fs_common_info->behaviors.lease_time != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00401       (fs_common_info->behaviors.supported_attrs != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00402       (fs_common_info->behaviors.homogenous != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) )
00403       ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NOTSUPP,0);
00404 
00405   SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, symlink_support );
00406   SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, link_support );
00407   SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, lock_support );
00408   
00409   SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, cansettime );
00410   
00411   SET_INTEGER_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, maxread );
00412   SET_INTEGER_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, maxwrite );
00413   
00414   SET_BITMAP_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, umask );
00415 
00416   SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, auth_exportpath_xdev );
00417   
00418   SET_BITMAP_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, xattr_access_rights );
00419   
00420   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"FileSystem info :");
00421   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxfilesize  = %llX    ",global_fs_info.maxfilesize);
00422   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxlink  = %lu   ",global_fs_info.maxlink);
00423   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxnamelen  = %lu  ",global_fs_info.maxnamelen);
00424   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxpathlen  = %lu  ",global_fs_info.maxpathlen);
00425   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  no_trunc  = %d ",global_fs_info.no_trunc);
00426   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  chown_restricted  = %d ",global_fs_info.chown_restricted);
00427   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  case_insensitive  = %d ",global_fs_info.case_insensitive);
00428   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  case_preserving  = %d ",global_fs_info.case_preserving);
00429   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  fh_expire_type  = %hu ",global_fs_info.fh_expire_type);
00430   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  link_support  = %d  ",global_fs_info.link_support);
00431   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  symlink_support  = %d  ",global_fs_info.symlink_support);
00432   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  lock_support  = %d  ",global_fs_info.lock_support);
00433   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  named_attr  = %d  ",global_fs_info.named_attr);
00434   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  unique_handles  = %d  ",global_fs_info.unique_handles);
00435   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  lease_time  = %u.%u     ",global_fs_info.lease_time.seconds, global_fs_info.lease_time.nseconds);
00436   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  acl_support  = %hu  ",global_fs_info.acl_support);
00437   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  cansettime  = %d  ",global_fs_info.cansettime);
00438   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  homogenous  = %d  ",global_fs_info.homogenous);
00439   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  supported_attrs  = %llX  ",global_fs_info.supported_attrs);
00440   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxread  = %llX     ",global_fs_info.maxread);
00441   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxwrite  = %llX     ",global_fs_info.maxwrite);
00442   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  umask  = %#o ",global_fs_info.umask);
00443   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  auth_exportpath_xdev  = %d  ",global_fs_info.auth_exportpath_xdev);
00444   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  xattr_access_rights = %#o ",global_fs_info.xattr_access_rights);
00445   
00446   
00447   ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR,0);
00448 }

00465 fsal_boolean_t  fsal_do_log( fsal_status_t  status )
00466 {
00467 
00468   switch( status.major )
00469   {
00470     
00471     /* here are the code, we want to trace*/
00472     case ERR_FSAL_DELAY:
00473     case ERR_FSAL_PERM:
00474     case ERR_FSAL_IO:
00475     case ERR_FSAL_NXIO:
00476     case ERR_FSAL_NOT_OPENED:
00477     case ERR_FSAL_NOMEM:
00478     case ERR_FSAL_FAULT:
00479     case ERR_FSAL_XDEV:
00480     case ERR_FSAL_INVAL:
00481     case ERR_FSAL_FBIG:
00482     case ERR_FSAL_NOSPC:
00483     case ERR_FSAL_MLINK:
00484     case ERR_FSAL_NAMETOOLONG:
00485     case ERR_FSAL_SEC:
00486     case ERR_FSAL_SERVERFAULT:
00487       return TRUE;
00488       
00489     default :
00490       return FALSE;
00491   }
00492
